channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gilgo Beach Defendant Rex Heuermann Is Charged in a Seventh Killing
item.description: The man whom authorities call a serial killer was charged with second-degree murder in the case of Valerie Mack, who disappeared in 2000.

item.title: Taco Bell is introducing an unexpected new menu item—going up against competition where ‘loyalty runs deep’
item.description: New offering will come with a slight Mexican twist.

item.title: Syria’s Rebel Leader Vows to Disband Armed Factions
item.description: The leader of the rebel coalition that swept to power last week said that fighters would be brought under the defense ministry’s authority. It was not...

item.title: The pros and cons of Medicare Advantage plans
item.description: Advice to help you choose between Original Medicare and Medicare Advantage plans.

item.title: A former Fed president says she would not cut interest rates this week, but she expects the central bank will anyway
item.description: The Federal Reserve is expected to cut its key interest rate by 25 basis points on Wednesday.

item.title: Map: 7.3-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Vanuatu
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Rich families pay this admissions specialist up to $750,000 to get their kids into the Ivy League
item.description: They start preparing for college as early as 5th grade.

item.title: Paul Watson, Anti-Whaling Activist, Is Released After 5 Months in Prison
item.description: Mr. Watson was facing extradition to Japan but was released after Denmark decided to reject the extradition request, his lawyer said.

item.title: Who Was Igor Kirillov, the Russian General Killed in a Moscow Bomb Blast?
item.description: The general had faced sanctions for using chemical weapons in Ukraine.

item.title: Magnitude 7.3 Earthquake Hits Vanuatu, Triggering Internet Outages
item.description: A tsunami alert was lifted for the Pacific island nation, but government websites were offline after the quake. The U.S. Embassy building was seriousl...

item.title: PG&E Secures $15 Billion Loan From U.S. Energy Department
item.description: The loan, the biggest-ever commitment from the Loan Programs Office, is intended to fund the California utility’s grid and climate resiliency projects...

item.title: The only FTC commissioner who didn’t vote to crack down on junk fees just so happens to be Trump’s pick to lead the FTC
item.description: Andrew Ferguson, Trump's choice to replace Lina Khan at the FTC, was not looking to force hotels or live-event promoters to disclose extra fees up fro...

item.title: Huawei Mate 70 Contains Similar Chips to Previous Phone, Suggesting Stalled Progress
item.description: An analysis of Huawei’s latest series of smartphones, the Mate 70, found chips that showed little progress from those used in last year’s devices.

item.title: Syria’s Rebel Leader Vows to Disband Armed Factions

item.title: Who Was Igor Kirillov, the Russian General Killed in a Moscow Bomb Blast?
item.description: The general had faced sanctions for using chemical weapons in Ukraine.
